name: desirably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is attractive or wanted by most people: tuna with a desirably high fat content At 35 I no longer felt desirably young. See
desirable
More examplesFewer examplesDivorce doesn't necessarily give rise to single-parent families, but often, and more desirably, families with two parents who live separately.I find the website desirably reliable and easy to navigate.Desirably, the current income of investors and other entrepreneurs should reflect their share of the profits of their activities.
